csw:Record.dct:abstract: WB or Water bodies is a 10-day synthesis product that detects water bodies over Africa. The product is a fusion of the former VGT4Africa Small Water Bodies and seasonality (SWB), the Global Water Watch (GWW) and a Permanent Water mask (PW) derived from Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM) and Modis water mask (MOD44W). The WB products are produced by the VEGETATION image processing center (CTIV) at VITO.
csw:Record.dc:description: WB or Water bodies is a 10-day synthesis product that detects water bodies over Africa. The product is a fusion of the former VGT4Africa Small Water Bodies and seasonality (SWB), the Global Water Watch (GWW) and a Permanent Water mask (PW) derived from Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM) and Modis water mask (MOD44W). The WB products are produced by the VEGETATION image processing center (CTIV) at VITO.
csw:Record.dc:source: The algorithm is based on a fusion of three existing products as an attempt to get the 'best available products'. The VGT4Africa (SWB) is based on a method using different thresholds for the Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) and the Normalized Difference Water Index (NDWI). The Global Watch Water (GWW) is based on a method taking 10-daily Mean Composites, performing a colorametric transformation from RGB to HSV color space and using different thresholds for the Hue component and the reflectance in the middle infra-red (MIR). The Permanent Water (PW) is based on the MODIS Water Mask (MOD44W) and Shuttle Radar Topography Missino (SRTM) to generate a consistent permanent detectin product over the African continent. The input data are the daily reflectance source data (for GWW layer) and 10-daily refelectance sources (for SWB layer) measured by the SPOT-VGT sensor as provided by the SPOT-VEGETATION CTIV.
